column5: Spent last week in Cuba, our third trip there.. as usual a great time, here some pictures I wanted to share.    It was wierd... the old breast implants were all over the beach... must have washed down from Florida!    This flamingo never left the pond!    Lotsa creatures along the beach.    Some fairly big fish swimming by the pier.      Avery going parasailing... lol.. braver than me!!      Happy to be back!!    The clay man in the restaurant!!     My favorite.. well one of them.. bars!    Finally got to do some fishing on the bridge.. only had an hour though... Moniques got a good story, but I finally outfished her.. and she had the locals helping her!      Avery...    I finally hauled in this monster!!   thay are the toughest things to set the hook on!!    And then I got this one... It SNORTED at me!!    We even had elephants in  our room.    Kids did some Kayaking.    Avery played some volleyball.. I would have but I think I would have stroked out.. its was hot!    We even went out and trolled behind the paddle boat.. chased a stingray for a while, but no luck.    At least the seagulls liked the bait!    We went for a HUGE walk down the beach... then ran in to a local easter party!    This crab attacked Moniques shoe... I think it was incensed by the smell.    The beaches are incredible..    Our family.    Ah the lobster dinner at the lobster shack!    I'm not sure whos more red...Monique or the LOBSTER!!    Some flora!    The pool bar!    Im gonna be a chef!    Some friends we met from Toronto.. Jim & Marylin, He caught two nice snappers... red ones... off the bridge where we  fished form..  He's gonna get me the pictures... he got them back to the resort and they cooked on up.. fantastic.  All in all a great family trip..  I highly recommend Cuba for a family vacation, affordable, safe and you cannot find friendlier people on or off the resort.
that awsome! im leaving next friday... were you in veradero?
Very nice boss.
Awesome report Boss it sure looks like you had a great time out there congratz to ya all and thanks for sharing.
Grunts are awesome TJ!!!  lol
very nice!!!!! finally out fished the mrs.!!!!!  you know your in for a whoopin now  peps
Great pictures TJ.  Looks like you all had a fabulous time.  That lobster sure looks good.  Joey
You make me sick. Geek guys doing vacations down south.What up wit dat???????????  lmao Awesome report and nice to see you all having a great time.

Great report TJ, looks like a lot of fun! Cuba is one place I'm DYING to visit for a variety of reasons. Great pictures too by the way, I'm always surprised at how few people can take decent pictures, maybe it's just my circle.  OZ

I am glad you had a good time and the weather cooperated, when I was there in February I don`t think it got above 14 C the whole week plus we had 7 consectutive red flag days and if that wasn`t bad enough our flight home was 4 hours late.
Well done and glad to hear you all had a wonderful time  Thanks for taking the time for the post and pics  Welcome back to the land of ice and snow eh
Very nice bud..Tanx Joe
I recognize that place.

Cuba is one of the nicest places I have ever visited but you do want to go 5 star or be prepared for very basic food and drink choices. No matter where you go in Cuba, the people are wonderful.  Where did you stay TJ?

I always like those vacation pictures on here it gives yo a sense of being there . Somebody else had a set as well a while ago. This board is great for having a terrific variety of subjects.Thanks for the great report and the fine pictures  TJ
Nice Looks like a  great trip!
Looks like a great vacation, always nice to see the family having a great time.  Thanks for posting T.J.  But next time include some more fishing pics   J/K
Thanks for all the replies.. it was a blast.. we were at the Iberostar Daquari, i would highly recommend it for a family.
looks like a blast!   thanks
Great times TJ.  I'll bet that pink Flamingo is missin' a few feathers now .
TJ, I hat to tell you this but your son is taller than you now!
Thats a good thing... he can carry me around now.
